Topic.Title: Wonder when the state pension funds will require GPs to exit Amazon?

Message.Msg: cw, those internet sales tax issues, isnt that for everybody though? I use to use AMZN for everything. I moved to the west coast and since being in Washington State now, I do have the additional tax since AMZN is hq'ed here. It made me look at other sites more frequently. Amazon does not always have the best deals. Overstock, walmart online, newegg, etc I have all used instead of just Amazon because of this tax. Now my question is wont the internet sales tax effect all these companies equally? I know that deduction is pea brained because it would still effect PPS due to slim margins but it wont it effect ALL these companies?

Topic.Title: Wonder when the state pension funds will require GPs to exit Amazon?

Message.Msg: Actually, unless the MSFA or equivalent is passed, it will hit Amazon which negotiated direct deals with many states to delay collection. eBay's retailers do not have to collect and AMZN is arguing that its 3P fulfilllment shouldn't either (which is where I expect CALPERS to weigh in and make it happen cause if Amazon doesn't, CALPERS pulling out of direct and indirect investments would cut this in half overnight...). So, Amazon will have a much worse position versus online for 2013 until specific legislation passes. It is at parity in the most populous states (CA, NY, PA, TX, etc).

Message.Title: report: AMZN sales up 25% 1st two weeks of December ... that misses consensus of 27%!
Message.Msg: Stock should drop, but I would expect additional upgrades on that news. Scamazon's growth has been fading for 3 Q's now .. the trend is dropping as they are struggling to add more than $14B per year in sales. (FY12 sales will increase less than FY11 did on a $ basis - leading to huge % gain drop ... not good for a stock with a forward P/E of more than 140).

Topic.Title: report: AMZN sales up 25% 1st two weeks of December ... that misses consensus of 27%!

Message.Msg: And how much cash flow does Amazon generate on those sales? :-) The cost structure for the physical goods business is heading south. Google just added an iTunes match equivalent for music. Now Apple and Google just have to do that on books and BEAT all Amazon digital books prices by 10%. Amazon is going after their core businesses, so there should not be any anti-trust issues in responding to competition...

Topic.Title: Now i know why this POS rallied 12pts in two days--

Message.Msg: Rocco is a #$%$ He has little understanding the underlying economics and competitive dynamics. There is no real moat here. All non-Kindle physical product can be sourced somewhere else (and TGT/WMT has superior economics on almost all of it). All digital product has already passed peak margins as the price competition is just really ramping up there. Amazon's "investment" will not decline nearly as rapidly because it is AWS infrastructure that constantly needs to be upgraded and replaced... The long lived stuff is off balance sheet. Prepare for the long term. Let the longs hold all the risk. There is material event risk here. Much more material than any other stock I follow...

Message.Title: RBC using a 4% free cash flow yield for his target price
Message.Msg: great. But some investors require a free cash flow yield of 8 9 or 10% which would put AMZN's price target at $130-$160. If you used a 4% free cash flow yield for AAPL, you would be looking at a target price north of $1000/share. What kind of vooodoo is wall street pushing trying to justify AMZN's share price. Is this some kind of joke? 4% free cash flow yield and ESP's. #$%$.
